title: The Apprentice's Lord Sugar fires Kenna Ngoma after boys lose again
text:
Kenna got the chop (Picture: BBC)

The Apprentice hopeful Kenna Ngoma was the second candidate to be fired by Lord Alan Sugar in this year’s series.

Just 14 contestants remain now that the 24-year-old entrepreneur was booted out of the competition to win the business mogul’s eye-watering £250,000 investment.

Kenna, an Ice Cream Company owner, fell short after failing to lead the boys to victory in an ice cream related task. Yep, Jesus wept.

Project manager Kenna brought back his fellow team members Dean Ahmad and Ryan-Mark Parsons back to face Lord Sugar, Claude Littner and Karren Brady, but it was his head that was on the chopping block.

As he made his final decision, Lord Sugar said: ‘Dean I’m sorry my friend but it is unforgivable that you’ve lost the potential of £300 worth of profit for this task. Unforgivable.

‘But you know what, I wonder whether it wasn’t you that screwed it up.

Kenna reckons Dean should’ve been sent packing (Picture: BBC)

‘Kenna, he [Dean] came back with a potential order for £400 and you as the manager should have gone, “Bingo, I’m going to make sure we produce this bespoke product” and you didn’t.’

‘And for that reason Kenna, you’re fired.’

Speaking exclusively to Metro.co.uk, Kenna told us that he thought Lord Sugar’s ruling was incorrect.

‘I think Dean should have gone,’ he said. ‘From my point of view, all he had to do was make sure what the costs were.

‘We made exactly what he said we should make and then it was for him to shake hands or finalise a pre-agreed deal.

‘The fact that he got nothing is absolutely criminal.’

Luckily though, Kenna and Dean are on good terms and there is no bad blood between them.

‘We got on outside of recording,’ he added. ‘It wasn’t anything personal. It was nothing malicious against him, he just had to go.’

The Apprentice continues Wednesday at 9pm on BBC One.
